page.title: 11 AYNHO - ROADS
page.content: There are 5 roads leading to other places. The {MAIN ROAD} is the A.41 trunk road. It starts in London and comes to Aynho via Watford, Aylesbury and Bicester. Then it carries on northward to Banbury, Birmingham and the north-west. It is a very busy road used by lots of lorries. The {B.4031} comes to Aynho from Buckingham via Croughton. It carries on westward to Clifton, Deddington and joins the Banbury-Chipping Norton road. It used to be a turnpike road, and there was a toll cottage at the junction of Portway and A.41. There is a {COUNTRY ROAD} which leads to Charlton and Farthinghoe. There are plans to build the M.40 {MOTORWAY} in a few years time. It will follow the Cherwell Valley from London to Birmingham. Portway is an old road now a track.
